channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pavement causes rainwater to run towards house not toward kerb and road, 29th October
item.description:
4 pavement slabs outside 18 Queens Retreat and 2 pavement slabs outside 17 Queens Retreat cause rainwater to run towards houses not run towards the kerb and road. This is causing damp issues in 18 Queens Retreat and the party wall between 18 Queens Retreat and 17 Queens Retreat.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Queens Retreat, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover causing noise issues when vehicle goes over it, 29th October
item.description:
The manhole cover outside number 153 is loose and makes a loud noise when a vehicle goes over it. It’s loud enough to wake me up at night and I believe it’s loud enough for this to be a noise complaint to environmental health. The issue has been happening for over 1 month. Please respond or I will raise via local council noise complaint.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 157, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside driveway 6A The Avenue two potholes very large, 29th October
item.description:
A significant pothole, primarily the long one across the whole entrance to 6A The Avenue. A much smaller pothole next door has been marked with white paint, presumably for repair. Please repair the potholes outside 6A when you come to repair the smaller one outside 7 The Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, The Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More than 7 street lights are out, 29th October
item.description:
Along village Road leading up to Welch Road (a 3 minute walk) there are around 7-10 lamp posts fully out. It is incredibly dark and feels unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass on pavement. Also car looks to have broken into, 29th October
item.description:
Dangerous for dogs

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Haywards Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight still not working, 29th October
item.description:
The streetlight in front of 5/6 newdawn place is still not working. Some work men came out a few weeks ago, dug up the pavement and left it like that for more than a week and then came back to close it but it's still not working. This is becoming increasingly more dangerous as the nights get darker. Often people walk or cycle past in dark clothing and can't be seen. Neighbours have reported many near misses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 29th October
item.description:
Customer reporting bollards are very dirty and non-reflective - has witnessed 2x near misses in the past week or so due to their visibility
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on southbound Princess Elizabeth Way exit from Kingsditch Roundabout, 29th October
item.description:
On the 2-lane exit from Kingsditch Roundabout onto Princess Elizabeth Way. The pothole is immediately on the exit, causing vehicles in the left lane to swerve into the right lane to avoid it (not always checking the right lane is empty first).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large, deep pothole., 29th October
item.description:
What3Words: precautions.bats.title Very large deep pothole has opened up. Deeper than a tennis ball.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 29th October
item.description:
A cycling sign at the entrance to a footpath connecting Reddings Road with Springfield Close has been vandalised with graffiti. Thank You.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree stump to be removed, 29th October
item.description:
Enquiry 11454419: On May 10 2024 Scott White informed me that work has been instructed with a Job Acknowledgement for this financial year, for the tree stump outside 85 Andover Road. When will this work start, please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Andover Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A bollard has been knocked over and has lifted part of the pavement which is sticking up and is sharp., 29th October
item.description:
The bollard is on Cheltenham High Street on the Strand end. It just outside United News. It was noticed on the morning of 29th October but some passers-by thought it had happened earlier in the week. Not sure exactly how long it's been like this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling getting really bad, 29th October
item.description:
Numerous deposits on Pilley Lane particularly on the side by Windsor Cottage. Could we please have these cleaned up and a sign put up warning of patrols? Children walk this way on their way to school, it's a busy lane and the amount of dog poo is ridiculous. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plastic caught in tree, 29th October
item.description:
Probably from building site next door. Please can this be cleaned. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 167, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 29th October
item.description:
Several large potholes in this location. Starting to get very deep - possibly failed repairs after brook flooded. Water has now abated, taking the tarmac out of the repairs.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree fallen across footpath, 29th October
item.description:
The footpath runs from Church Road Woolstone down to Tirle Brook. The tree is near to the brook bridge. It has blocked the path and broken the wire fence. Part of the fallen tree is on private property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: There is water leaking onto the pavement from a storm water drain cover located on 144 Hucclecote road, Severn Trent have been out twice and it is not theirs and definitely a highways issue and needs to be sorted before the frost comes as it will be a danger to people working on the path especially my 90 year old parents, this has been reported to highways by several people including Severn Trent and needs to be sorted asap, 29th October
item.description:
The drain cover is by the fence on 146 Hucclecote Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
